article.name: In-Platform Release Notes
article.title: In-Platform Release Notes
article.body:
KnowBe4 will provide release notes for major features or updates that have been added to your Security Awareness Training Platform since you last logged in. These release notes will display as a pop-up on your screen. You can dismiss individual release notes by clicking Dismiss next to the one you wish to hide or dismiss all the release notes by clicking the Dismiss All button. To close the window without dismissing any of the release notes, click OK.

Here is an example of what those release notes look like:

For a list of our latest updates, we recommend bookmarking our Security Awareness Training Platform change log.

images.alt:
This image displays a modal dialog titled **"Release Notes"** superimposed over an obscured web application dashboard. The modal is used to communicate system updates chronologically.

**Modal Structure and UI Elements:**

*   **Title:** "Release Notes" (Centered, black text).
*   **Close Icon:** An 'X' icon is visible in the top-right corner for closing the modal.
*   **Action Buttons (Footer):**
    *   "Dismiss All" (Orange rectangular button).
    *   "OK" (Green rectangular button).

**Content Entries (Chronological Order, Top to Bottom):**

1.  **Update Entry 1:**
    *   **Date:** **03/03/2020** (Bold).
    *   **Action:** "Dismiss" (Blue hyperlink, right-aligned).
    *   **Text Content:** "We are continuing to refine the AI algorithm behind our Virtual Risk Officer (VRO). We've now expanded the types of training content that will be considered to reduce user risk scores. As a result of this change, your user risk scores may increase or decrease slightly, depending on their training history."

2.  **Update Entry 2:**
    *   **Date:** **03/09/2020** (Bold).
    *   **Action:** "Dismiss" (Blue hyperlink, right-aligned).
    *   **Text Content (Paragraph 1):** "We've added new training content to the **ModStore!** Check out our **February Content Update** for a list of the new content we added last moth [sic]." (Hyperlinks are blue).
    *   **Text Content (Paragraph 2):** "To stay informed about all the new content and features being added to your console, be sure to bookmark our **change log** and check it out for updates." (Hyperlink is blue).

**Global Navigation/Information Link:**

*   A persistent link appears above the footer: "To see all updates to your console, **view our change log**" (Blue hyperlink).

**Background Context (Partially Visible):**

The underlying dashboard includes a line graph (likely tracking user risk scores over time) and reference text on the right side: "See our **Virtual Risk Officer (VRO) Guide** for details about how Risk Scores are calculated."
